p: The high risk of serious illness or lethality in the elderly from COVID-19 is quite clear. According to the US Centers for Disease Control, hospitalizations, intensive care unit admissions, and case fatality rates are age-related [ 143]. The case-fatality rate in people 75–84 years old is about 10 times that in people 55–64 years old and about 40 times that in people 20–22 years old.
